quote_first: ... You had no reason to think the times important. Indeed how suspicious it would be if you had been completely accurate. ''Haven't I been?'' Not quite. It was
quote_last: that you talked to Wilkins. ''Another ten minutes."
title: The Quiet American
author: Graham Greene

quote_first: The play was set to begin at seven o'clock and finish before sunset. It was
quote_last: . Beyond the flats we could hear the hockey field filling up. the low rumble got steadily louder - voices, footsteps, the creaking of bleachers, the slamming of car doors in the parking lot.
title: Middlesex
author: Jeffrey Eugenides
